scrape¶

GradCafe scraping helpers for survey and result-page extraction.

scrape._is_restricted_path(url)[source]¶

Check whether a URL path is disallowed by configured robots rules.

Parameters:

url (str) – Absolute URL to validate.

Returns:

True when the URL contains a disallowed path prefix.

Return type:

bool

scrape._fetch_table_page(page_num)[source]¶

Fetch and parse a single /survey page.

Parameters:

page_num (int) – Survey page number to request.

Returns:

Parsed rows from the table, grouped by record.

Return type:

list[list[str]]

scrape._extract_result_num(url)[source]¶

Extract integer result id from a result URL.

Parameters:

url (str) – URL containing a trailing result identifier segment.

Returns:

Parsed result id or None when invalid.

Return type:

int | None

scrape._fetch_result_page(url, payload)[source]¶

Fetch one result page and populate a payload dictionary.

Parameters:

  • url (str) – Absolute result page URL.

  • payload (dict[str, str]) – Existing payload map seeded from survey-table fields.

Returns:

Updated payload, or empty dict on failure.

Return type:

dict[str, str]

scrape._concurrent_scraper(worker_func, tasks, is_mapping=False, all_payloads=None)[source]¶

Execute scraping tasks concurrently and aggregate successful results.

Parameters:

  • worker_func (collections.abc.Callable) – Callable executed per task.

  • tasks (collections.abc.Iterable) – Task iterable passed to worker function(s).

  • is_mapping (bool) – Whether each task maps to all_payloads[task] arg pair.

  • all_payloads (dict | None) – Payload lookup table used when is_mapping=True.

Returns:

Combined worker outputs.

Return type:

list

scrape._get_raw_payloads(data_rows)[source]¶

Build full raw payloads from collected survey rows.

The function seeds payloads from table rows, then fetches each linked result page to fill remaining fields.

Parameters:

data_rows (list[list[str]]) – Parsed survey table rows.

Returns:

Fully-populated payload dictionaries.

Return type:

list[dict[str, str]]

scrape.scrape_data(min_result_num=None, existing_urls=None)[source]¶

Scrape admissions records from GradCafe.

Parameters:

  • min_result_num (int | None) – Optional lower-bound result id filter.

  • existing_urls (set[str] | None) – Optional URL set to skip already-ingested records.

Returns:

Raw scraped payload list.

Return type:

list[dict[str, str]]
